abstract: Prince announced on Friday that he had signed an exclusive deal with the music-streaming service Tidal to release his new album, HITNRUN.
snippet: Prince announced on Friday that he had signed an exclusive deal with the music-streaming service Tidal to release his new album, HITNRUN.
lead_paragraph: Prince announced on Friday that he had signed an exclusive deal with the music-streaming service Tidal to release his new album, HITNRUN. A longtime advocate for artists’ rights, Prince recently began removing his music from most streaming services. But he has left his music on Tidal, the subscription service owned by Jay Z and more than a dozen other artists (Prince is not thought to be among them). Last month, Prince released a new single, “Stare,” on Spotify, another streaming service.

headline.main: Prince Plans to Make New Album a Tidal Exclusive
headline.print_headline: Prince Plans to Make New Album a Tidal Exclusive
